unnormalised: What's the best way to prep for JEE while managing school?
normalised: What is the best way to prep for J-E-E while managing school?

unnormalised: Okay, so balancing JEE prep with school can feel like juggling flaming torches, but it's doable! The key is strategy & consistency.
normalised: Okay, so balancing J-E-E prep with school can feel like juggling flaming torches, but it is doable! The key is strategy and consistency.

unnormalised: First off, **Time Management is KEY**. Seriously. Make a realistic timetable. Don’t try to cram 10 hrs of studying into a day when you have school from 8:00 AM to 3:00 PM and then tuitions. Be honest about your current study habits and gradually increase the time you dedicate to JEE prep. Include everything – school homework, JEE coaching (if any), self-study, and of course, breaks! Remember the pomodoro technique - 25 mins study, 5 mins break. It really works.
normalised: First off, time management is key. Seriously. Make a realistic timetable. Do not try to cram ten hours of studying into a day when you have school from eight in the morning to three in the afternoon and then tuitions. Be honest about your current study habits and gradually increase the time you dedicate to J-E-E prep. Include everything – school homework, J-E-E coaching (if any), self-study, and of course, breaks! Remember the pomodoro technique - twenty five minutes study, five minutes break. It really works.

unnormalised: Next, **Prioritize and Focus**. Understand the JEE syllabus. Identify your strengths & weaknesses. Concentrate on strengthening the weak areas without neglecting the strong ones. NCERT books are your bible, guys! Don't underestimate them. Master the concepts from NCERT first. Solve all the examples and exercises religiously. Then, move on to other reference books. For Physics, HC Verma is usually recommended, and for Maths, RD Sharma can be helpful. Chem – follow your coaching institute’s material closely.
normalised: Next, prioritize and focus. Understand the J-E-E syllabus. Identify your strengths and weaknesses. Concentrate on strengthening the weak areas without neglecting the strong ones. N-C-E-R-T books are your bible, guys! Do not underestimate them. Master the concepts from N-C-E-R-T first. Solve all the examples and exercises religiously. Then, move on to other reference books. For Physics, H-C Verma is usually recommended, and for Maths, R-D Sharma can be helpful. Chem – follow your coaching institute's material closely.

unnormalised: Now, let’s talk about coaching. If you are enrolled in a coaching center like FIITJEE or Allen, utilize it effectively. Attend all classes, do your assignments on time, and clear your doubts with the teachers. Don't just blindly follow what they say, understand the concepts. If you're not in coaching, consider online resources like Unacademy or Vedantu. They have excellent instructors and test series.
normalised: Now, let us talk about coaching. If you are enrolled in a coaching center like F-I-I-T-J-E-E or Allen, utilize it effectively. Attend all classes, do your assignments on time, and clear your doubts with the teachers. Do not just blindly follow what they say, understand the concepts. If you are not in coaching, consider online resources like Unacademy or Vedantu. They have excellent instructors and test series.

unnormalised: Speaking of tests, **Regular Testing is CRUCIAL**. Solve previous year's JEE papers religiously. Analyze your performance after each test. Identify the topics where you are making mistakes & work on them. Aim to solve at least 10 years of past papers. Remember, JEE is as much about speed & accuracy as it is about knowledge.
normalised: Speaking of tests, regular testing is crucial. Solve previous year's J-E-E papers religiously. Analyze your performance after each test. Identify the topics where you are making mistakes and work on them. Aim to solve at least ten years of past papers. Remember, J-E-E is as much about speed and accuracy as it is about knowledge.

unnormalised: Don’t forget about your health, okay? Get enough sleep (at least 7 hrs). Eat nutritious food. Exercise regularly. Mental health is just as important as physical health. Take breaks when you feel overwhelmed. Spend time with friends & family. Pursue your hobbies. Listen to music, watch a movie, or do whatever helps you relax and de-stress. Diwali break is for rest not endless study!
normalised: Do not forget about your health, okay? Get enough sleep (at least seven hours). Eat nutritious food. Exercise regularly. Mental health is just as important as physical health. Take breaks when you feel overwhelmed. Spend time with friends and family. Pursue your hobbies. Listen to music, watch a movie, or do whatever helps you relax and de-stress. Diwali break is for rest not endless study!

unnormalised: And finally, Stay Positive and Motivated. JEE preparation can be a long and challenging journey. There will be ups and downs. Don’t get discouraged by failures. Learn from your mistakes and keep moving forward. Believe in yourself and your abilities. Remember why you started this journey in the first place. Consult Mr. Sharma, our school counselor, if you are feeling overwhelmed or anxious. He’s genuinely helpful.
normalised: And finally, Stay Positive and Motivated. J-E-E preparation can be a long and challenging journey. There will be ups and downs. Do not get discouraged by failures. Learn from your mistakes and keep moving forward. Believe in yourself and your abilities. Remember why you started this journey in the first place. Consult Mister Sharma, our school counselor, if you are feeling overwhelmed or anxious. He is genuinely helpful.

unnormalised: So, yeah, that's about it. Good luck with your JEE prep! Remember, hard work, dedication, and a positive attitude will take you a long way. Crack that JEE and get into IIT-D or whichever college is your dream! You got this!
normalised: So, yeah, that is about it. Good luck with your J-E-E prep! Remember, hard work, dedication, and a positive attitude will take you a long way. Crack that J-E-E and get into I-I-T-D or whichever college is your dream! You got this!
